s.label: Enable numerical patterns if present
s.desc: If true, make use of any available numerical element pattern files. If numerical pattern data are missing, the functional type will be used instead.

s.label: Maximum order of spherical wave pattern
s.desc: For numerically-defined spherical wave patterns, the maximum order of the spherical wave to load.

s.label: Normalise element pattern
s.desc: If true, the amplitude of each element beam will be normalised to its value at the zeith; if false, then this normalisation is not performed.

s.label: Swap X and Y
s.desc: This setting should be considered a hack to swap the order of the X and Y responses in the output, if they come out the wrong way when using numerically-defined patterns.

s.label: Functional pattern type
s.desc: The type of functional pattern to apply to the elements, if not using a numerically-defined pattern.

s.label: Dipole length
s.desc: The length of the dipole, if using dipole elements.

s.label: Dipole length units
s.desc: The units used to specify the dipole length (metres or wavelengths), if using dipole elements.

s.label: Tapering type
s.desc: The type of tapering function to apply to the element pattern.

s.label: Cosine power
s.desc: If a cosine element taper is selected, this setting gives the power of the cosine(theta) function.

s.label: Gaussian FWHM [deg]
s.desc: If a Gaussian element taper is selected, this setting gives the full-width half maximum value of the Gaussian, in degrees.
